item.title: Why It's So Hard To Stop The World's Looming Famines
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Millions of people in Yemen and sub-Saharan Africa are facing food shortages and severe malnutrition. Host Audie Cornish talks with Justin Forsyth of UNICEF about the crisis.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Millions of people in Yemen and sub-Saharan Africa are facing food shortages and severe malnutrition. Host Audie Cornish talks with Justin Forsyth of UNICEF about the crisis. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/18/537907401/why-its-so-hard-to-stop-the-worlds-looming-famines

item.title: Kentucky Residents Express Dissatisfaction With GOP Efforts To Dismantle Obamacare
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Hundreds of thousands of people in Kentucky got health insurance under the Affordable Care Act, but the state is also home to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell who's led efforts to kill the law. With the failure of the latest GOP attempt to replace the ACA, the state's voters weigh in.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Hundreds of thousands of people in Kentucky got health insurance under the Affordable Care Act, but the state is also home to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell who's led efforts to kill the law. With the failure of the latest GOP attempt to replace the ACA, the state's voters weigh in. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537948591/kentucky-residents-express-dissatisfaction-with-gop-efforts-to-dismantle-obamaca

item.title: Conservative Media Express Outrage Over Republican Health Care Failure
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Conservative media are reacting to the failure of the GOP's latest health care plan with outrage and disappointment. The Republican bill was effectively blocked on Monday night when two more GOP senators came out in opposition to it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Conservative media are reacting to the failure of the GOP's latest health care plan with outrage and disappointment. The Republican bill was effectively blocked on Monday night when two more GOP senators came out in opposition to it. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537948563/conservative-media-express-outrage-over-republican-health-care-failure

item.title: After Demise Of GOP Health Care Bill, Insurance Companies Wonder What's Next
item.description: July 18, 2017 - With the demise of Republican efforts to both repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, there's likely to be an impact on consumers and companies that depend on the health care law.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - With the demise of Republican efforts to both repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, there's likely to be an impact on consumers and companies that depend on the health care law. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537948556/after-demise-of-gop-health-care-bill-insurance-companies-wonder-whats-next

item.title: Death Of GOP Health Care Bill Deals Political Blow To President Trump
item.description: July 18, 2017 - The Republican-led effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act appears to be dead, dealing political consequences to the party and President Trump.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - The Republican-led effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act appears to be dead, dealing political consequences to the party and President Trump. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537948542/death-of-gop-health-care-bill-deals-political-blow-to-president-trump

item.title: Tennessee Insurance Commissioner Outlines What GOP Failure Means For Health Care
item.description: July 18, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Tennessee Insurance Commissioner Julie McPeak about what the collapse of the Better Care Reconciliation Act means for Tennessee.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Tennessee Insurance Commissioner Julie McPeak about what the collapse of the Better Care Reconciliation Act means for Tennessee. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537948521/tennessee-insurance-commissioner-outlines-what-gop-failure-means-for-health-care

item.title: Sen. McConnell's Plan B To Repeal Affordable Care Act Fails
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Three Republican senators Tuesday effectively scuttled Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell's plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act without replacing it. This was hours after the Senate's bill to repeal and replace Obamacare was blocked when two more GOP senators came out in opposition to it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Three Republican senators Tuesday effectively scuttled Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell's plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act without replacing it. This was hours after the Senate's bill to repeal and replace Obamacare was blocked when two more GOP senators came out in opposition to it. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537948514/sen-mcconnells-plan-b-to-repeal-affordable-care-act-fails

item.title: After Low-Key Lobbying Effort, Trump Says He Was 'Let Down' By Senators
item.description: July 18, 2017 - The president was blindsided by the latest collapse of a Republican health care bill, which happened just after a White House dinner he held with seven lawmakers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - The president was blindsided by the latest collapse of a Republican health care bill, which happened just after a White House dinner he held with seven lawmakers. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537904716/after-low-key-lobbying-effort-trump-says-he-was-let-down-by-senators

item.title: Health Care: Were The Risks Of Repeal Without Replace Too High?
item.description: July 18, 2017 - The Republicans' last-ditch attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act now and replace it later would have caused insurance rates to soar, and millions could have lost coverage within a year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - The Republicans' last-ditch attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act now and replace it later would have caused insurance rates to soar, and millions could have lost coverage within a year. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/18/537868412/health-care-the-risks-of-repeal-without-replace

item.title: Pushing Hospitals To Reduce Readmissions Hasn't Increased Deaths
item.description: July 18, 2017 - The Affordable Care Act penalizes hospitals if patients are discharged and then readmitted with the same problems too often. That effort has improved care for patients, two researchers say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - The Affordable Care Act penalizes hospitals if patients are discharged and then readmitted with the same problems too often. That effort has improved care for patients, two researchers say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/18/537696772/pushing-hospitals-to-reduce-readmissions-hasnt-increased-deaths

item.title: The Loyal Republican Senator From Kansas Who Helped Kill The Health Care Bill
item.description: July 18, 2017 - "I am a product of rural Kansas," Sen. Jerry Moran said earlier this month. "I understand the value of a hospital in your community, of a physician in your town, of a pharmacy on Main Street."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - "I am a product of rural Kansas," Sen. Jerry Moran said earlier this month. "I understand the value of a hospital in your community, of a physician in your town, of a pharmacy on Main Street." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537877556/the-loyal-republican-senator-from-kansas-who-helped-kill-the-health-care-bill

item.title: Death Knell Sounds For Senate's GOP Health Care Bill
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Senate Republicans have shelved their health care bill after two more Senate Republicans, Mike Lee and Jerry Moran, announced their opposition to the bill Monday night.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Senate Republicans have shelved their health care bill after two more Senate Republicans, Mike Lee and Jerry Moran, announced their opposition to the bill Monday night. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537844748/death-knell-sounds-for-senates-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: That Drug Expiration Date May Be More Myth Than Fact
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Hospitals and pharmacies are required to toss expired drugs, no matter how expensive, vital or scarce. And that's even though the FDA has long known that many remain safe and potent for years longer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Hospitals and pharmacies are required to toss expired drugs, no matter how expensive, vital or scarce. And that's even though the FDA has long known that many remain safe and potent for years longer. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/18/537257884/that-drug-expiration-date-may-be-more-myth-than-fact

item.title: Republican Health Care Bill Falls Short, Dealing Blow To Trump Agenda
item.description: July 17, 2017 - Republicans Sen. Mike Lee and Jerry Moran have put their names in the no column, bringing to four the GOP senators opposed. As it stands, there aren't enough votes for an Obamacare replacement.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - Republicans Sen. Mike Lee and Jerry Moran have put their names in the no column, bringing to four the GOP senators opposed. As it stands, there aren't enough votes for an Obamacare replacement. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/17/537803874/gop-senators-come-out-against-republican-healthcare-bill-ensuring-it-cant-pass
